div.div:
BVSD is a leader in Colorado and beyond in academic excellence and instruction innovation. Our outstanding classroom teachers, exemplary schools, and programs support student achievement.
Learn More

The Boulder Valley Board of Education has seven members who each represent one of seven different districts throughout the geographical area of BVSD.
Learn More

img.alt: A student addresses the Board of Education during a meeting.

div.div:
Boulder Valley School District's teams are dedicated to supporting the district's mission of educating students.
Learn More

Learn about the Boulder Valley School District's biggest projects.
Learn More

img.alt: two boys smiling by their lockers

div.div:
Informed and involved parents are a key to student success, so in the Boulder Valley School District we are dedicated to providing families with all the resources they need.
Learn More

BVSD has 56 schools in 11 different communities. All offer BVSD's high-caliber curriculum and instruction, but each has the autonomy to meet the needs of its students and communities.
Learn More

Stay up-to-date on BVSD events and download the academic calendar.
Learn More

BVSD is committed to hiring diverse candidates who bring high quality skills and knowledge. We are looking for individuals who have a growth mindset and are seeking opportunities to collaborate with colleagues and the community to create an exceptional learning experience for kids. We hope you will join our team.
Learn More

The Boulder Valley School District is dedicated to having a collaborative relationship with its stakeholders. We welcome your feedback.
Learn More

div.a: BVSD to continue Home Learning through the end of the school year

div.p: BVSD has decided to continue Home Learning through the end of the current 2019-2020 School Year and the 2020 Summer Learning program.

article.a: Read More about BVSD to continue Home Learning through the end of the school year

div.p: To make sure all students were prepared for home learning, staff created backpacks of supplies, learning materials, and books. Staff volunteers distributed these to students over three different days at nine locations across the district. "It's all together for all students and families," says Angel Stobaugh, Director of Language Arts and Humanities.

article.a: Read More about 2,000 Backpacks distributed to elementary students

div.a: Chromebook distribution connects students to school at home

div.p: Our goal is to connect all students with devices and the internet at home so they can fully engage in their learning. Over 7,000 devices have been distributed for students across the district, and our IT team has been working with families who need the internet through a variety of different options.

article.a: Read More about Chromebook distribution connects students to school at home

div.p: Home learning is in full swing as we wrap up week 2. It has been a heavy lift for everyone involved. While not everything worked perfectly out of the gate, we appreciate everyone’s patience and flexibility.

article.a: Read More about Home Learning in full swing

div.p: We will continue to follow the guidance of Colorado Governor Polis and our partners in public health, who have access to the latest and most up-to-date data modeling.

div.a: In person learning will remain suspended, at least through April 30

div.p: As you may have heard, this afternoon Colorado Governor Jared Polis announced in person learning will remain suspended longer than originally expected – at least through April 30.

article.a: Read More about In person learning will remain suspended, at least through April 30

div.a: Stay at Home Orders- Materials and Food Distribution will continue as scheduled

div.p: Our plan for the distribution of technological devices this week at our buildings, as well as future plans to distribute paper materials and food after Spring Break, will continue as scheduled.

Tonight, Governor Polis signed an executive order suspending in-person learning in schools across the state until April 17.

article.a: Read More about BVSD Home Learning Until April 17

div.p: As we begin the first full week of school closures, we wanted to provide you with some additional information regarding what our next steps will look like, if we are unable to return to our buildings following Spring Break.

article.a: Read More about Home Learning Plan
Read More about Emergency Food Distribution Plan

div.a: Boulder Valley School District Schools Closing Starting March 13 to Limit Spread of Coronavirus

div.p: At the recommendation of Boulder Public Health, we will be closing all schools in Boulder Valley, beginning tomorrow, March 13, 2020 through the end of Spring Break (March 29, 2020).

article.a: Read More about Boulder Valley School District Schools Closing Starting March 13 to Limit Spread of Coronavirus

div.p: In conjunction with recommendations at the local agency level, BVSD has made a decision on upcoming travel to protect students and staff. We feel that the below steps are warranted because of the growing health risks to our students and concerns that they could be quarantined far from home.
